comment: Professor Martin is a really nice guy and does the best he can to make the class enjoyable. He lets you use your notes and book for the tests. However, a lot of the questions are conceptual, so his lectures and homework are really helpful. It isn't a hard class, there is just a lot of information.

Dr Martin was a good professor - definitely very knowledgeable about tax accounting and explains the concepts along with their many scenarios pretty well. The tax projects can be time-consuming, especially the second one, so make sure to start them early. Exams are open note/book, but it would still help to read over the chapters before the exams.
Makes learning about tax really enjoyable. 3 tests and a cumulative final plus a lot of homework on connect. Tax project as well that is time consuming.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: The project tax assignments are time consuming. Wish he made his own tests instead of a test bank. Open notes on the exams

Dr. Martin is extremely knowledgable regarding accounting and specifically tax accounting.  Online homework and small projects are time consuming, but valuable resources. The book is only needed if you need clarification of items discussed in class. Tests are straight forward, no tricks.

Easy class, just make sure assignments are completed on time. Didn't get much feedback on the assignments. Wish we got credit for the course because I feel like you put in enough effort that it should count for something.

I enjoyed Professor Martin. This class was hard, but the tests are open notes/book. I had to miss a few classes due to my work schedule, and felt like I did not completely understand the assignments if I did not attend class. Be prepared to read the chapter and complete all homework. I enjoyed the class.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He is a straight forward professor. He is clear with expectations and he is very approachable. PowerPoints are online, but it is good to go to class where he explains in more detail. Connect is used for homework problems and he grants unlimited attempts. If you get stumped you should utilize office hours and he will help you solve a problem.
Overall pretty good. It's a hard subject, but tests are open note/book. Easy grading on projects.

Homework through Connect,exams are open book,research paper, and a group project in the class. Easy to attain an A if you attend class, and read the book. Dr. Martin is easily accessible through email or office hours,and he really takes the time to make sure that the students gets the material.

Dr. Martin is an excellent professor. I am currently taking him for Federal Taxiation. He lets you use all notes, powerpoints, and book for the test, which are very helpful, because the tests can be somewhat difficult. We have a Tax Research paper due as well as a Tax Return. Pretty easy class. You should at least get a B, even an A if you try.
Marin is very knowledgable in the world of tax.  He is very helpful and treats you with respect.  I have enjoyed his class a great deal, and would recommend him to anyone who is interested in tax.

Martin is okay. He tries to make sure that students understand the material, but tax is boring unless you're super into it. He's a little outdated in his knowledge, but don't call him out on it if he's wrong. He's a little sensitive about that and he's super arrogant. Exams are hard. Study. Do well on the return projects and use that to buffer.

I would definitely recommend taking his course. He explains everything very we'll with extremely helpful handouts. Tests are hard but if you attend class, keep with with online assignments you will have no problem passing. If you attend class and pay attention I would recommend taking it online!

Great professor-not the most approachable person but if you make the effort he really does help you. tests are open note and book but you need some form of knowledge before going in to a test. Do not wait last min to do the project you will regret it.
One of the best professors at KSU. He is very knowledgable and explains things very well. Tests were open book but were pretty hard. Just go to class and take notes and study the poweropints.
GREAT!!!!

Great Professor! Very knowledgeable in taxes and his lectures are fun and interesting too. He gives you a lot of opportunities to bring up your grade. I made an A in the class because I took advantage of his hw points and quizzes.

One of the best acct profs at KSU! Crystal clear explanations of concepts and number crunching. He actually inspired me to make my concentration accounting, imagine that! Tests are fair, but they are not easy by any stretch. Take him if you can.

Essentially a good teacher, I'd disregard the bad reviews for this class.  Some of what he says is a bit confusing, but ultimately the quiz/homework dynamic helps you work really well.  Do the quizzes and you can do well on tests.  Lots of extra credit was also very nice!

Great teacher.  He really knows the material.  He takes time to ensure everyone understands everything.This is tax, so it can be boring. Be prepared for class, read and do the homework (it's not turned in). It will help. There are 2 take home test (tricky), 2 quizzes, 1 tax reseach memo, and 1 partnership return.

He's a nice guy. His class is pretty easy. He doesn't go all that great of a job explaining the material, but it's nothing you can't figure out on your own. He gives extra credit. It would be really hard to fail his class.

He was nice enough, but he mumbled and rambled. I did ok on the quizzes but would fail tests horribly. His test questions were trick questions!! Homework is  helpful, but he doesn't explain things very well. Every explanation goes into a long, complicated, drawn out answer. Very confusing!
Gives many opportunities to get a good grade even if your a bad test taker.

Prof. makes a very diificult course very manageable. I got tests of 81,99,78 and still got and b/c of extra credit opps. I didn't even need to pass the final to get an A (which I did). Take him if you can, this class could be a nightmare with anyone else.

Great teacher. Tests are fairly difficult and sometimes tricky. Many opportunities for extra credit. Study 4 or 5 days in ADVANCE before his test, you cannot cram for this class! I would take him again. 3 Exams, 1 Final, 1 Budget project, and Homework Mananger

Tests are nothing like the quizzes he gives you. He repeatly states that if you know the material on the quizzes you will do well on the tests.  I have aced every quiz and despite countless hours of studing have yet to pass a test.  Will retake with a different professor

Personality wise, yeah sure he is a good guy.  As far as course material goes..quizes/homework are easy with tons of extra credit.  His tests are another story! NOTHING like the quizes he gives you.  I think he puposely tries to trick you on them.  Not ONE has resembled anything like the quizes.. I wouldn't take him again..

Mr. Martin explains things well. You think you've got it until you take the exam. I recommend you study hard! Unless this comes natural to you. I studied 7 hours for the second test after recieving a 75 on the first exam, and I scored a 90. So study! He doesn't really make room for questions in his lecture, or he just seems annoyed at them
He really knows his stuff when it comes to Taxation.  Three exams, a tax return project, and a tax memo is what he grades you on.

Mr. Martin is the best teacher I have had at KSU. I wish I could take him for all my classes. He is a great lecturer. There are plenty of opportunities for extra credit and lots of review. Take him for sure.

ACCT 2200 was easier than 2100. He gives out good worksheets that help you with the homework. The quizzes are taken from the same question bank that exams come from. He takes the highest of either your homework or quiz grade and there is extra credit built in. Do the homework, study for exams and it's pretty easy.
I would highly recommend.
very helpful. he runs his own accounting firm so he brings a lot of working knowledge to the class but in a relatable and understanding way.
Very nice guy. He always gives class notes that pertain to each chapter. Quiz are pretty easy. Got a C without having a book. Make sure you study and you will get better grade than me.
Explains everything well and relates it to the real world.  Just have to show up, pay attention and take good notes to do well in the class.

Overall good prof.  He provides lots of extra points to give a cushion/curve in his grading. One big budget project at the end of the semester, but it's only worth 50 points. I learned a lot without a ton of effort. He is very clear in his lectures, but a little redundant. I would take him again.

He was very helpful and excited when people understood the various parts of his lectures. A little extra credit on quizzes when I took him Fall of '07, but I know the book has changed a lot and there is a lot of online work that we didn't have. Definitely take him!
He made tax fun and interesting.  Related the class a lot to the real world.  Would recommend this teacher to anyone who really wants to learn about tax!
Recommend, good teacher and helpful. best acct teacher at ksu

he's an awesome teacher. Whoever said he was a red neck is totally wrong. This man is soo sincere and really does know that his students have a life outside of school. I totally recommend his class. I didn't do any of my homework and still made an A cuz he gives so many bonus points.
No Comments
I recomend this guy. Very nice, clear about what will be on the test, great teacher, and easy to talk to. He understands that students have lives outside of school.

Martin is an excellent professor. He really cares and understands that students have jobs/lives outside of classes so he is really flexible. Wants students to succeed. No attendance policy but going to class helps. Gives you a study guide for multiple choice exams.
Love this guy!I had him for both acct classes and he did a wonderful job. Easy to listen and talk to. Very helpful.
Great professor--very helpful, very clear.  Sincerely cares, uses real-world examples, makes it relevant to any job you may have in the future.  Wholeheartedly recommend.
Good Teacher, gives great reviews for the tests and lets you know exactly what to expect.
